alert.note: Alert for Iron; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 14 at 12:27PM MST until February 14 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Washington County in southwestern Utah... South central Iron County in southern Utah... * Until 100 PM MST * At 1226 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near New Harmony to 13 miles north of La Verkin to 10 miles north of Quail Creek State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 26 and 47. Locations impacted include... Zion National Park, La Verkin, New Harmony, Toquerville, Kanarraville, Pintura and Kolob Canyon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
